channel.title: Please help
channel.description:
i am new to scar and am riteing my first proper script...well ive been good with everything up till now i tried hard to fix it but i couldnt =( so now i have resorted to this.
procedure tug; begin repeat sendkeys('a') wait(175) sendkeys('a') until(10000) end; this is line 27 (this is not on the script =P)
procedure reset; begin clickmouse(462,425,true) wait(4000) clickmouse(309,154,true) wait(1000) end;
Line 27: [Error] (27:1): Type mismatch in script
if you could help me with this i will be very happy =)
oh yea and could someone tell me wether if you put a number in until(****) is it how many times it will repeat or how many seconds if it is how many times please tell me how to put time in there =P
PS could someone please tell me how to make those box things that ppl put there scripts into so it dosent take up so much room, thanks

item.title: Please help
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“jesus pwns zezima, post:4, topic:216829”]ok thank you very much for your help =)

#edit# time:=getsystemtime; in between the : & = it says Identifier expected in script

any help?[/quote]
You forgot to declare time as a variable. To do this, above the top most procedure or function, put a var then underneath put: time: Integer;.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

In the Until loop, it must be a Boolean and not a String, Integer or Extended number.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

the problem is the until. if you want tug to run for a certain amount of time, just get rid of the repeat and until in the procedure, and in the main loop, have something like this:

begin time:=getsystemtime; repeat tug; until(getsystemtime-time=10000) end.
with time being an integer variable

Read full topic

item.title: Please help
item.dc:creator: @jesus_pwns_zezima jesus pwns zezima
item.description:
@jesus_pwns_zezima wrote:

i am new to scar and am riteing my first proper script…well ive been good with everything up till now i tried hard to fix it but i couldnt =( so now i have resorted to this.

procedure tug;
begin
repeat
sendkeys(‘a’)
wait(175)
sendkeys(‘a’)
until(10000)
end; this is line 27 (this is not on the script =P)

procedure reset;
begin
clickmouse(462,425,true)
wait(4000)
clickmouse(309,154,true)
wait(1000)
end;

Line 27: [Error] (27:1): Type mismatch in script

if you could help me with this i will be very happy =)

oh yea and could someone tell me wether if you put a number in until(****) is it how many times it will repeat or how many seconds if it is how many times please tell me how to put time in there =P

PS could someone please tell me how to make those box things that ppl put there scripts into so it dosent take up so much room, thanks

Read full topic
